author: SteveL-MSFT
body:
Requires VS2017 latest preview to build for arm64.  Validated win-arm build on Win10 IOT with remoting, but current install script doesn't work correctly on Win10 IOT, need to update.

Also fixed issue with pwrshplugin.dll not validating path before using them.

Fix https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/5286
<!--

If you are a PowerShell Team member, please make sure you choose the Reviewer(s) and Assignee for your PR.
If you are not from the PowerShell Team, you can leave the fields blank and the Maintainers will choose them for you. If you are familiar with the team, feel free to mention some Reviewers yourself.

For more information about the roles of Reviewer and Assignee, refer to [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md).

-->

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Waiting on mmi.dll to be published for win-arm and win-arm64

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Confirmed that basic PSCore6 works on win-arm, I think we can merge this.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @adityapatwardhan hold off on merging this, looks like I need to build pwshplugin.dll for arm

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: Once the changes to building `pwshplugin.dll` is done, the `psrp.windows` package needs to be updated, and make sure the arm version plugin dll is signed before creating a new nuget package.

comments.author: adityapatwardhan
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT please update here when `psrp.windows` package is updated.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: Note that PR #5617 would also require `psrp.windows` nuget package to be refreshed, so it's better to coordinate them to avoid duplicate work.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Have some paths hardcoded to validate build.  Will update, but requires user to have VS2017 latest installed to build for win-arm.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Verified pwrshplugin.dll works on both arm and arm64.  @adityapatwardhan can you re-review this PR as I've made substantial changes for the native compilation?

comments.author: adityapatwardhan
comments.body: @daxian-dbw Can you have a look too?

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: @adityapatwardhan Yes, will look tonight or first thing tomorrow morning.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body:
@TravisEz13 @daxian-dbw @adityapatwardhan please review the change to the pwrshplugin config reader to address https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/5286

Decided to do that as part of this PR since I'm publishing a new drop to myget might as well do it once rather than twice.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT Making those changes means we need to create a new `psrp.windows` package. But that work doesn't block merging this PR.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @daxian-dbw yeah, I realize that.  After this is merged, I'll create one called RC2.

comments.author: adityapatwardhan
comments.body: @daxian-dbw @TravisEz13 Any ideas why WIP might be blocking this?

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: it hasn't run, edit the title and it will run.

title: build: Enable building for win-arm and win-arm64
